answers.answer: Vomiting in cats can be caused by many different things.Diabetes is one cause that is high on the list.  Please bring him to the vet and have him checked for diabetes ASAP.  Other possible causes include: inflammatory bowel disease or other digestive disorder, gastrointestinal parasites, food allergy, constipation and anal gland problems, gastrointestinal neoplasm, and others.  Only a vet visit and appropriate diagnostic testing can sort this out.Probiotics and digestive enzymes and anti-parasitic medication may be all that he needs, but the vet must make that determination.

HELP!!  After spending the day yesterday trying to find a VET that would allow a payment plan or at least wait till my next pay(2wks).  I have found nothing in my area.  My cat continues to vomit.  He still eats healthily and still is drinking normally.  But within 2 or 3 hrs its vomit time.  And it is really stinky!!!Is there anything I can do or give to my 16 yr old cat that will help him until I find a VET for help?  Like people meds or electrolytes or whatever?

question: My 16 year old cat continually vomits.  Not just after eating.  He will wake in the middle of the night and vomit.  He has also had some nasty flatulation!!!  He is generally an inside cat that uses the great outdoors for his litter box.  He has been known to eat grasses.  He doesnt chase the mice and squirrels or birds anymore.  At one point 4 years ago he weighed almost 25lbs.  Now I would guess he has lost 10 to 15 pounds.  He continues to eat and drink - but - I am getting seriously worried about the vomiting!!!What do you think?
title: 16yr Cat Vomitting Problem
